payment_of_terms.extracted_content: Unless otherwise specified in a SOW, payment terms shall be Net 30 days from receipt of invoice.
supporting_evidence: Net 30 days from receipt of invoice

subcontractor_flow_down_terms.extracted_content: Provider may engage subcontractors to perform portions of the Services, provided that: Subcontractors agree to be bound by terms equivalent to those in this Agreement
supporting_evidence: Subcontractors agree to be bound by terms equivalent to those in this Agreement
Provider remains fully responsible for subcontractor performance
All subcontractors meet Customer's security and background check requirements

limitation_of_liability.extracted_content: EACH PARTY'S TOTAL LIABILITY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT SHALL NOT EXCEED THE GREATER OF (A) $500,000 OR (B) THE TOTAL AMOUNTS PAID OR PAYABLE TO PROVIDER UNDER THIS AGREEMENT IN THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS PRECEDING THE EVENT
supporting_evidence: Specific liability cap of $500,000 or 12-month payments
Exceptions for confidentiality breaches and willful misconduct

product_discounts.extracted_content: Volume Discounts: (a) 1,000-2,499 hours annually: 5% discount (b) 2,500-4,999 hours annually: 10% discount (c) 5,000+ hours annually: 15% discount
supporting_evidence: Tiered volume discount structure based on annual hours

customer_name.extracted_content: Metropolitan Manufacturing Corporation, a New York corporation with its principal place of business at 4500 Industrial Parkway, Buffalo, NY 14225
supporting_evidence: Legal entity name in contract header

lien_waiver.extracted_content: No specific lien waiver provisions found in contract terms
supporting_evidence: Comprehensive review of all articles and exhibits
No mention of lien waiver rights or requirements
Standard technology services agreement without construction elements

liquidated_damages.extracted_content: Service Level Defaults: Minor service level breach (90-95% of target): 2% of monthly service fees; Moderate service level breach (80-89% of target): 5% of monthly service fees; Material service level breach (below 80% of target): 10% of monthly service fees. Delivery Delays: Days 1-5: $1,000 per day; Days 6-15: $2,500 per day; Days 16+: $5,000 per day
supporting_evidence: Detailed liquidated damages schedule for service level breaches
Specific daily penalties for delivery delays
Escalating penalty structure based on severity
25% cap on total liquidated damages per SOW

warranty.extracted_content: Provider warrants that: (a) Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner (b) Services will conform to applicable industry standards (c) Deliverables will be free from material defects for ninety (90) days after delivery

indemnification.extracted_content: Provider shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Customer from third-party IP infringement claims. Customer shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Provider from claims arising from Customer's breach, negligence, or modification of Deliverables
supporting_evidence: Provider IP indemnification for third-party claims
Customer indemnification for breaches and modifications

intellectual_properties.extracted_content: Customer shall own all right, title, and interest in work product specifically developed for Customer, subject to Provider's retained rights in its pre-existing intellectual property and general methodologies
supporting_evidence: Provider retention of pre-existing IP and methodologies
Perpetual license grants for incorporated Provider IP

insurance.extracted_content: Provider shall maintain: Commercial General Liability: $2,000,000 per occurrence; Professional Liability: $2,000,000 per claim; Cyber Liability: $5,000,000 per claim; Workers' Compensation: As required by law

termination.extracted_content: Either party may terminate this Agreement for convenience with sixty (60) days written notice. Either party may terminate immediately for material breach, insolvency, or cessation of business

federal_requirements.extracted_content: Provider shall comply with all federal requirements including: Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) provisions; Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS); Export Administration Regulations (EAR); International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR)

ability_to_assign_contract.extracted_content: Neither party may assign this Agreement without the other party's prior written consent, except: Assignment to an Affiliate; Assignment in connection with merger, acquisition, or sale of substantially all assets
supporting_evidence: General prohibition on assignment without consent
Limited exceptions for affiliates and M&A

labor_escalation.extracted_content: Hourly rates may be increased annually by no more than five percent (5%) or the Consumer Price Index increase, whichever is lower, with sixty (60) days written notice
supporting_evidence: 5% or CPI cap, whichever is lower

prevailing_wages.extracted_content: For work performed on projects subject to prevailing wage laws, Provider shall: Pay all workers prevailing wages as determined by applicable authorities; Maintain certified payroll records; Post required wage determination notices

bill_rates_included.extracted_content: Standard hourly rates: Senior Architect: $275/hour; Senior Consultant: $225/hour; Consultant: $175/hour; Junior Consultant: $125/hour; Project Manager: $200/hour
bill_rates_included.source_section: Article 3.3 - Bill Rates and Exhibit D.1
supporting_evidence: Detailed hourly rate schedule by role

additional_invoice_instructions.extracted_content: All invoices must include: Detailed time records, milestone completion documentation, expense receipts and supporting documentation, progress reports. All invoices must be submitted through Customer's electronic procurement portal. For projects exceeding $100,000, Customer may withhold five percent (5%) of each payment as retainage

nda.extracted_content: Each party agrees to: Hold all Confidential Information in strict confidence; Not disclose Confidential Information to third parties without prior written consent; Use Confidential Information solely for purposes of this Agreement

site_requirements.extracted_content: All Provider personnel requiring access must pass comprehensive background checks including: Criminal history verification, employment history verification. Provider personnel may be subject to pre-assignment and random drug testing. All Provider personnel must complete Customer's mandatory security training program. Provider shall implement cybersecurity controls consistent with NIST Cybersecurity Framework, ISO 27001 standards, SOC 2 Type II requirements

change_order_process.extracted_content: Any changes to an executed SOW must be documented in a written change order signed by authorized representatives of both parties. Change orders shall specify: Description of the change, Impact on timeline and deliverables, Cost adjustments, Resource implications

shipping_terms.extracted_content: For any hardware components: Delivery shall be FOB destination; Provider shall arrange and pay for shipping and insurance; Customer shall inspect deliveries within 5 business days; Provider shall provide tracking information for all shipments

deliverable_requirements.extracted_content: Specific Services shall be described in individual Statements of Work including: Detailed scope of work and deliverables, Timeline and milestones, Acceptance criteria and testing procedures. All project documentation shall be delivered in both electronic and physical formats
deliverable_requirements.source_section: Article 2.2 - Statements of Work and Article 19.3

small_business_reporting_requirements.extracted_content: Provider shall make good faith efforts to utilize small business subcontractors and suppliers. Provider shall submit quarterly reports detailing small business participation, including: Dollar amounts paid to small business subcontractors, Percentage of total contract value, Types of work performed by small businesses

licensing.extracted_content: Provider warrants that all personnel performing Services requiring professional licenses or certifications maintain current, valid credentials. Provider personnel shall maintain relevant industry certifications including: Cloud platform certifications (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), Cybersecurity certifications (CISSP, CISM, CEH), Project management certifications (PMP, PRINCE2)

suspension.extracted_content: Customer may suspend performance under this Agreement if: Provider fails to meet critical security requirements; Provider personnel fail background checks or security clearances; Regulatory or legal requirements prevent continued performance

effective_date.extracted_content: This Master Service Agreement is entered into as of March 15, 2024 (Effective Date)
supporting_evidence: Clearly stated effective date in header

extraction_challenges: Complex mutual indemnification structure required interpretation
IP ownership framework spans multiple articles
